title: Take That say they ‘keep Jason Orange involved’ despite having left the band
text:
Howard Donald, Gary Barlow and Mark Owen are the current Take That line-up (Picture: Bruce Glikas/FilmMagic) Take That have explained why Jason Orange left the band back in 2014, and how they ‘keep him involved’ in everything they’re cooking up. 
Drake admits to drunk texting former flame J-Lo on his new album More Life The ‘man band’ currently consists of Gary Barlow, Howard Donald and Mark Owen, with the former five-piece previously including Jason Orange and successful solo supreme Robbie Williams.
While they’ve previously remarked how they’d like both members to return for the band’s 25 th anniversary, it seems they still don’t quite fully understand why Jason left in the first place.
Howard Donald, Mark Owen, Gary Barlow, Robbie Williams and Jason Orange are the original Take That line-up (Picture: Dave J Hogan/Getty Images) Asked by The Sun if they understand the full reason behind Jason’s departure, Mark replied: [Shakes his head] I don’t think there’s a reason. It’s quite simple: he doesn’t want to do it.
‘It’s not like he has a bad ankle, that would be easier. It’s his choice and we’ve got to respect that. We tried our best to convince him. We’re still in contact.
‘We always try to keep him involved in everything that we do to some extent, so he knows what our plans are. Every now and again we drop into conversation: “Hey, do you fancy coming back next year?”
More: Music 'Is Drake a Brit now?!' Rapper drops new album More Life and he's gone a bit grime

Gary Barlow also reassured fans this isn’t a scenario akin to Robbie’s initial messy departure in 1995, saying it’s an ‘open door’ for both members.
‘We’ve had that before [when things didn’t end well with Robbie] and we’ll do anything not to go there again. It has been left on a good note and it’s an open door for Jay and Rob.
Take That in the innocent 90s days (Picture: L. Busacca/WireImage) ‘This band is for us all to come and go as we please.’
It’s certainly a mantra which was adopted recently, after Robbie re-joined the band for a special performance of The Flood on BBC’s Let It Shine.

If you want a taster of what the three-piece sounds like in 2017 however, check out their latest single Giants.
Take That’s new album Wonderland releases on Friday, March 24.
